Simplified Issue Term Life Insurance

If you’re looking for a quick and easy way to get life insurance, we offer a simple online application with same-day approval. Rates begin low to help you get started, then increase with age, and coverage can last to age 90.
  • This is bold text Coverage amounts $2,500 - $100,000
  • This is bold textHelp cover debts and expenses
  • This is bold textNo medical exam, just a few health questions
  • This is bold textAvailable online or by phone
Read FAQs
get my quote

Get My Quote

Then apply online!

click to call click to chat

Level Term Life Insurance

Level term life insurance is often the most affordable because it covers you for a specific time period at a set price. It can help cover financial responsibilities like mortgage and college costs, or supplement a permanent or work policy.
  • Coverage amounts $100,000+
  • Help cover debts aFixed rate for the 10-30 year term length*
  • Good for years when you have dependents at home or higher living costs
  • Online application available
  • For our lowest rates, contact a representative
Read FAQs
get my quote

Get My Quote

One Year Level Term Life Insurance

Not sure what coverage you need? We also offer one year term life insurance as a short-term solution.
  • Get covered while you figure out long term plans
  • Add optional rider to extend coverage for up to five years and allow for conversion to a permanent policy
  • View rates or speak to MetLife financial professional to learn more
Read FAQs
get my quote
This plan has an extensive network of dentists and specialists across the country.
  • Large network of dentists, and the freedom to visit any dentist in or out-of-network.
  • Additional savings when you visit a participating dentist – typically 15% - 45% less than the average fees charged by dentists in the same community.1,2
  • No paperwork in or out-of-network, if your dentist submits your claims for you.
  • Service where and when you want it on our secure member website.
  • Preventive care, such as cleanings, is usually 100% covered.

Ask your employer about MetLife Dental Insurance.

Comprehensive coverage to protect your health and your wallet, available in select states only.

Please note: MetLife HMO plans are only available to employees living in CA, FL, NJ, NY and TX.

  • Broad network of participating dentists to choose from.
  • Pre-select a dentist at time of enrollment.
  • Hundreds of services/procedures provided at costs that may be lower than typical dental fees.1,2
  • No deductibles to meet and no claims to submit.

Ask your employer about MetLife Dental Insurance.

If your employer offers MetLife Auto & Home's group car insurance program as part of your employee benefits, you could receive special savings. Some membership associations have discounts, too.

Find out if you're eligible:

  • Group discounts. Most people saved an average of $500 per year!3 We can offer these savings because your employer provides you access to a group insurance program with special low rates as part of your employee benefits.
  • Coverage that stays with you. If you retire, leave your company or go on leave, you can still continue your coverage without interruption or change.
  • Great features. Even though the policy's cheaper, you'll still have access to all our policy benefits. These include replacement coverage for total loss, rewards for good driving, enhanced rental car damage coverage, identify theft protection and more.2

Get my quote

Or call 866-607-0871

FAQs
View All
What are the benefits of term life insurance?
Term life insurance is life insurance coverage designed to be purchased for a specific time period, typically between 10 and 30 years. Term life insurance is an affordable way to get valuable coverage throughout that time frame, and so is great for helping to cover specific financial responsibilities, such as paying for a mortgage or college expenses.
What are the benefits of term life insurance?
Term life insurance is life insurance coverage designed to be purchased for a specific time period, typically between 10 and 30 years. Term life insurance is an affordable way to get valuable coverage throughout that time frame, and so is great for helping to cover specific financial responsibilities, such as paying for a mortgage or college expenses.
What are the benefits of term life insurance?
Term life insurance is life insurance coverage designed to be purchased for a specific time period, typically between 10 and 30 years. Term life insurance is an affordable way to get valuable coverage throughout that time frame, and so is great for helping to cover specific financial responsibilities, such as paying for a mortgage or college expenses.
What are the benefits of term life insurance?
Term life insurance is life insurance coverage designed to be purchased for a specific time period, typically between 10 and 30 years. Term life insurance is an affordable way to get valuable coverage throughout that time frame, and so is great for helping to cover specific financial responsibilities, such as paying for a mortgage or college expenses.

Thank you for contacting us.
Someone from MetLife will be reaching shortly to provide you help.
CALL: 1-800-METLIFE
ALL OTHER CONTACT OPTIONS

*The ‘term length’ refers to the time frame in which the policy rates will not go up (level premium period). Significantly increased premiums are necessary to renew the policy after the end of the level premium period. Premiums will increase on an annual basis after the level premium period. This policy is renewable to age 95. Like most insurance policies, MetLife's policies contain exclusions, limitations, reductions of benefits and terms for keeping them in force. For complete costs and details, see your MetLife Representative. All product guarantees are subject to the financial strength and claims-paying ability of the issuing insurance company.

Simplified Issue Term Life insurance rates are based on current age, gender and face amount. Premiums will increase every 5 years up to age 90 on the policy anniversary date after you reach an age ending in "1" or "6” (for example: 41, 46, 51). There is no medical exam for this product, just some health questions. Coverage is guaranteed to age 90 so long as premiums are paid. Product features and availability may vary by state. Monthly premium rates shown are as of June 2015 and may be subject to change. If the insured dies by suicide within the first two policy years, we will refund the premiums paid, less any policy loans. Simplified Issue Term Life insurance is issued by MetLife Insurance Company USA, Charlotte, NC 28277 (form #5E-26-13), and in New York by Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166 (form #1E-26-13-NY).

For our lowest rates on level term life insurance, contact a MetLife Premier Client Group representative. Guaranteed Level Term is issued by MetLife Insurance Company USA on policy form #5E-23-12 (except in NY) and by Metropolitan Life Insurance Company on policy form #1E-23-12-NY(NY only). MetLife Term Life insurance is issued by MetLife Insurance Company USA, Charlotte, NC, 28277, policy form #5E-23-12 (except in NY) (not available in all states), and by Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166, policy form #1E-23-12 NY (NY only). Met of CT YRT3 is issued by MetLife Insurance Company USA, Charlotte, NC 28277. GenAm One-Year Term is issued by General American Life Insurance Company, St. Louis, MO 63128. NEF YRT4 is issued by New England Life Insurance Company, Boston, MA 02111. MLIC One-Year Level Term Life is issued by Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166. MetLife One Year Term is issued by MetLife Insurance Company USA , Charlotte NC 28277 (except in NY) and by Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166 (NY only). All are MetLife companies.
